name: Debbie Bast
text: I haven't had the chance to experience anything with this office. They are always closed. Website says they are open today but Ooops, no they are not! Website said they were open last week as well. They do not answer the phone. Had to take the day off because license expired yesterday. I know state gives you a 30 day grace, but the government doesn't. I'll try again tomorrow and if they are closed, I guess I'll get another day off. 😡

name: Maria Smith
text: I have been waiting almost 2 hours to do a simple transfer of a drivers license!!! I can be understanding of their systems being down the day before but they do not move through the sign in sheet efficiently at all!!!

name: emilee rister
text: This is my second attempt to obtain an Alabama Drivers License. They are open 2 days a week, 2 employees. The first time I waited 3 hours in my hot car. Finally had to leave. This time I’ve been here 2 hours it’s hot out but don’t want to run my car because hello there’s a gas shortage. This is worse than the worst DMV nitemare!  Get your act together Alabama!! This is cruel and abusive treatment.

name: Kenneth Carey
text: Pretty bad.  Been in the car for two hours.  You are going to need to burn a vacation day to come here.  Can they give an accuse note like doctors note for missing an entire day of work?

name: Lisa King
text: Get there early. They are always busy and there is a line before the doors open. Staff is very friendly!😁

name: Cody Baughman
text: Called 10 times no answer

name: paul peters
text: Always helpful and informative

name: SHERROD Henry
text: Two people working with 30 people waiting! I've been here since 8:59am and it is now 11:18 and still haven't been seen still a wait, and the take lunch between 12-1! Sucks I'm from Atlanta and it still moves faster with 200 people waiting.

name: James Kirkland
text: All day trip!

name: LISA PINTO
text: It's ridiculous to be open for 2 days. Everytime I go in there it's busy because everyone can only come those 2 days instead of during the week. What a joke.

name: Dianna Odore
text: Wonderful people

name: Thomas Coutu
text: Easy to locate , execellant service.

name: Dennis Deskin
text: Really loved them personal and experience getting my driver's licenses

name: Felicia Elliott
text: I made an appointment for 2/6/2020 and recieved the confirmation email. I show up 5 minutes early and the guy at check in tells me I'm not on the appointment sheet. He said appointments are 2 and a half months out. Evidently, my confirmation email doesnt matter. What's the point of having appointments if they dont honor them. The email also stated what I needed. I brought it and evidently that still wasnt enough. This ace is a huge joke and they refuse your requesting to speak to someone about the appointment issue. Avoid  at all costs!

name: audrey haskin
text: Very slow process. Waited for an hour OUTSIDE to renew my car tag

name: Marvssa Jenkvns
text: Checked out of school because it says it’s open on Wednesday!! It’s not 🙄 now my excused absence was wasted 😐 so Thxx a lot

name: Abby Goggins
text: Took my daughter for her drivers license today and it was the best experience I’ve ever had at a dmv. Angela was pleasant to work with, quick, friendly and professional. The instructions are a bit confusing, between what’s online, phone recording, and signs posted in the building…but everyone there was helpful and friendly.

name: Amanda Story
text: Online it states they open at 8am. My son and I get over there to get his permit and they tell me "the slots are all full" apparently you have to be there at 6am to fill in a time slot and if you don't get there early enough you're SOL.

name: Aaron Harvey
text: Slow as molasses. Was there at 7 appointment at 9. Called in at 10:30 had stop for worker lunch break with 20 questions left for CDL. Was back at 12:30 waited a while. Had to retake test because it timed out done at 1:20 6 hours 20 mins for CDL. Worker was friendly

name: Justin Martini
text: Went to get information on switching license and registration from out of state. Was told I had to come back at 615 in the morning to get a time slot for the day. Completely ridiculous.

name: Jacqueline Lammon
text: I've lived all over the world and have never waited so long for a driver's license test, renewal or change of address.  It takes days! This office needs more staff and an efficiency expert.

name: Anthony Skin
text: Worst dmv in the state , inefficiently ran  ,and not enough staff went to get the STAR ID put on my license and waited for 5 hours just to be told to come back tomorrow and had to wait 3 more hours at that. Something needs to change!

name: Cyndi Harbison
text: Set there for 2 hours.. after taking off work to go only to be told no more road test for today come back tomorrow...guess they operate under the assumption no one works for a living!!! Some lady was on her third day there... glad to see my tax dollars at work!!!!

name: Kolyn M
text: This is the worst DMV EVER! Picked a number and waited.... another female walks in picked a number sat down and start nagging she’s late for work. She walks into the room and said she’s late for work they sat her down and took care of her. And a few other people who just walks in whom it seemed like their family or friends just by the way they’re talking and laughing... I’ve waited almost two hours till I was finally called.... HORRIBLE DMV EVER!

name: Ethan G
text:
Be warned, they stop doing title work at 4:00 so they can close at 4:30. I was turned away at 4:05.
If you work a full time job good luck getting your registration updated.

name: Lisa Feher
text: Fine..just needed 6 month handicap plate

name: tony neja
text: Have lived in Cherokee Co for seven years.  They have always been very friendly and helpfull.  Especially compared to the Tag Offices in GA!

name: SirNBK
text:
I have the sense of 5 Karen's sitting around laughing at the phone. You know the Karens...  fat, frosted hair, 30 year post cheerleaders that still think they're fine, never made it out of the small town. Their only recourse for their failed life is to not answer the phone for the rest of us that need these civil "servants" to do their predetermined, post cheerleader existence.
Do your job and answer the phone.... you'd think with all the bad reviews someone in the state would do something.

name: Cindy Stinson
text: You all were right!!  I left four messages over two days & no return call as promised on their message! Finally went in today...assistance not much better than no return call! Didn’t look as though the five employees were being over worked! No one in line (2 did come on after me) no phones ringing (are they on silent maybe??) so can’t imagine why they can’t return one of my 4 left messages.   ..and had to ask for the supervisor before getting someone willing to help me!! No such thing as a public servant anymore these days.🙁

name: Christina DuBose
text: People to there are very friendly and helpful.  Sometimes you have a wait but it's not bad

name: Barbecue AnytimeAnyplace
text: Every time I have to go here everyone is relatively friendly.

name: Andy long
text: They simply don’t answer the phone. I work at a title pawn across the state line and occasionally have to deal with them. By not answering the phone they are potentially costing the state of Alabama a lot of money. If the state doesn’t bother to hire people that will answer the phone it seems they don’t care.

name: Dylan Rogers
text: They answer my calls so I don’t know what number y’all are calling. They’re always helpful and nice.

name: Thomas Rager
text: The lady that assisted me was great. However I was making comment (just a comment I was not being rude)about the difficulty that Alabama puts you through to get tags changed from other states. The office manager Tabitha Davis butted into our conversation with a rude and threatening comment. Then when I called her out on her comment. She tried to say it wasn't a threat, when the other people in the room heard what she said.

name: Leisa Sparkman
text: I have called several times and no one ever answers the phone.

name: BJ Major
text: Great customer service.  Tabaitha went out of her way to help me correct a mistake on a title.

name: Carlos Millas
text:
Close!!!only for phone call.
But no body answer your call.
And menu is not work too.
Remember when you vote!!!!

name: Jessica Johanning
text: After repeatedly getting no help for months in my own county in North Alabama, one call and 10 minutes later an amazing employee, Monica, helped us out and everything was resolved! It was a fantastic experience getting such wonderful help from such a pleasant person. Thank you Monica!

name: blue berry
text:
The title portal is confusing and difficult to use. When you call, an automated voice tells you six times in a row to press 1 to get help online. Don't do it! If you press 1, it tells you a website URL that doesn't work (it requires a password, but the one you use for your title application doesn't work and you CAN'T make an account), and then hangs up on you so you lose your place in line. If you don't press 1, it repeats this message, six times in a row, every five minutes that you are on hold. So if you're on hold for an hour, you are going to be told 72 times to go to a website that does not work.

They have to be doing this on purpose to decrease call volume, instead of simply hiring more staff or fixing their online chat portal which I would much rather have used.

The reason I'm giving 3 stars instead of 1 is because of your employee Christy - she was professional, kind and helpful. If you're not going to hire more employees to field calls, at least give her a raise!!!

name: Kim Staab
text: Do not come off hold, per menu prompts for customer service contact via email.  Website is given and no where to contact/chat with customer service.  REMAIN ON HOLD

name: Jacob Freeman
text: Can’t get anybody to help you. Very hard to even get anybody to answer the phone

name: Manny
text: Horrible service getting to phone calls, absolutely unacceptable. 15 min wait time on hold at a minimum, just to "transfer you" to a line that will hang up on you.

name: Stephanie Urquhart
text: It has been nearly a month and we're still waiting on our title. If you call, you'll be placed on hold for 5-10 minutes, then you are forced to select option one to be told how to submit a request online. At that point the automated system will hang up on you. If you try to select any other number, you'll get the same result. Still waiting on a response to my online request as well. This is unacceptable!

name: Johnny Prince
text: No help. On hold for hrs

name: Alan Blackman
text: Had no problems walked right in registered was called up immediately lady at window 3 was great. Helped me with paperwork got my apportioned tag and was outta there,

name: Mickie Delee
text: These people are a joke. When you call the automated messaging machine gives options to speak with an individual about license renewals and suspensions. After going through all steps you only ever get a busy signal. I’ve been calling four months and have still gotten nowhere with my license. I no longer live in Alabama, thank God!! So I would really appreciate whomever is in this department to answer their phone! I’ve called every single hour literally from 8am central to 5pm central! As the hours are listed online as well as when you call! I also don’t understand why a lady answered the phone this morning and told me to call another number, (that also did not answer!), and told me that they do not deal with driver licenses?😳 Do you not know where you work? What other departments are listed as in your building at the same business address that you arrive at Monday thru Friday? Either way. I will be thankful to get this all over with so I can completely uproot my life and name from Alabama! I can’t take the state nor any of its officials or “legal services” seriously! The poorest state! From law to individuals. 🤮

name: Love
text: I would give this place a 0 out of 5 if I could bcuz soon as you call them, it doesn't put you on hold it just automatically hand up on you. I live halfway across the country now and need to fax paperwork to them but I've been calling for 2 days and still no answer smh

name: Cody Moore
text: Most unhelpful people iv had to deal with in a long time. They need to be restaffed imediatly!

name: C Williams
text: Takes forever to receive new title in the mail.  2 weeks and counting.

name: Lindsey Gee
text: About an hour's wait, but there were a lot of people....very friendly, helpful staff, though. Just FYI, 4% debit/credit card fee if you don't bring cash. :)

name: Terence Houchin
text: And we wonder why Alabama is the laughing stock of the. country. 10-14 days for an accident report. What? Do we have to teach the staff how to read and write before they can get accident reports out? Supervisors out sick , is anyone really actually working? This is your state tax dollars at work smh.

name: randy kynard
text: Ive been trying to get someone to answer for 2 hours ive been on hold👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻

name: Asher Snyman
text: Terribly slow. Not sure if they are understaffed but I saw a lot of staff walking around  behind the windows, and in and out of the employee door. Heard somebody else complaining and employee responded that they were on lunch and that they shouldn't even have come to the front by the desks. Nobody was helped for the first 20-30 minutes that I was here. Somebody got special treatment in that they walked up to the window directly and were helped before anybody else because "they had been here earlier in the day".

name: Maria Herring
text: No im pissed,  some m.f. stole title, now im here

name: Aaron Jones
text: Automated person says they are closed on a monday at 1pm. Even though they are suppose to be open till 5pm.

name: Justin Pitts
text: Have called several time checking the status of a title has been months an nothing but being put on hold for 30+ minutes they are worthless an this is what tax payers pay for

name: hailey bradley
text: It’s like REALLY slow

name: Matt Golden
text: Basically wait  till it's time to close and the  start testing.

name: Emma Ritchie
text: No one in vehicle registration ever answers the phone. No cash payments at “Satellite locations”makes no sense to me on the renewal notice. I don’t use checks, so I needed to talk to someone & see if I could send CASH in the envelope. Tried to renew online, but for whatever reason it couldn’t verify my vin. Called again, never got a call back. I work 7 days a week & don’t have time to take off for a 40 minute drive there & back, plus waiting for 2+ hours for this when I should be able to just do it online. I sent my fiancé to renew it today. Not sure how it works in a— backwards Alabama (Florida transplant) but this is my only option since no one answers or returns phone calls!!

name: Nancy Williams
text: Extremely busy and waited forever!! Clerk was very helpful and efficient!! They only had a couple clerks working which didn't help with the moving of the line!!

name: Bruce Collins
text: I called to check on requirements for a vehicle titled in Georgia that I had purchased and will tag in Alabama. I called but got no live person, I did receive a recorded message stating to leave a message and contact number,  and someone would get back with me. It has been almost 48 hours and still I have not received a callback. Follow through can use some work.

name: Nick Elliott
text: I had a great experience at the tag and title office. They are very helpful and called me to update me on my title status.

name: Pamela Collins
text: They do not deserve even 1 star! They are rude and most of them don't even know what they are doing. I have been up there 5 times and still do not have a tag. Trying to get one name off my title and every time they tell me something different! Stood in line all 5 times for 2-4 hours. Just ridiculous!!!! 😡

name: Debi Breedlove
text: Have always had GREAT experiences at the satellite offices and the purchase by mail for tags.  I would NEVER again buy in person at the courthouse!   Our current situation in different.  I have never dealt with a title change.  I recently gave our grandson a vehicle so it involves a title change...he works full time - long hours...and the hours of this necessary service are absurd for working people!  He will have to go to Ozark...closes at 5:00!!  I have tried 6 times to call to see if I can get the tag for him or if he has to go.  No answer.  Have NEVER gotten an answer at the tag office and I have called numerous times trying to get questions answered about titles!  Got so desperate I called Montgomery - they said to call Ozark where no one ever answers the phone.  Commissioners need to investigate this operation and work toward making it user friendly for customers...at least have someone assigned to answer phones!!  Our grandson recently bought a house in Dale County.  Being closed EVERY Friday and closing everyday at 5:00 is ridiculous!!

name: Angel Ayala Valcarcel
text: Always good people and polite with me. Well,  I'm an old grandfather, maybe is because of that. Jijijijijijijiji

name: Teddy Gill
text: May have to wait. But always been informative and very curtis.

name: Cori Baker
text: The lady that helped me was very friendly and the line moved quickly! My only suggestion for improvement is that they open on Fridays

name: dakota lambert
text: walked in at 2 got out at 4 I just wanted to get a new tag they really need to speed up the process

name: Joe Holyfield
text: Excellent service/ The best customer service.

name: Bryan Bowman
text: License renewal was quick and staff was very friendla

name: Tonya Eutsey
text: Needs more workers and better organization.

name: Keith Stanfield
text: This go 'round, limes moved quick and staff was very friendly, which I'm not used to when going to these places in any county.

name: M.E Tharpe
text: They can never get it right.

name: David Nelson
text: Quick and professional service!

name: Bruce is Wild
text: Pack a lunch. You'll be there a while.

name: Henry Clark
text: Waited in line for ~40 minutes, but awesome employee's!

name: Jenson Bartlett
text: I was pleasantly surprised by my experience here. I arrived around 10am on a Wednesday and found no line. I was helped right away. Turns out I was missing a bill of sale for my vehicle, but they partially filled out the information and allowed me to fax it to my seller from their office. Especially helpful and kind were Mrs. Sandra and Debbie whom helped me throughout my visit. Thank you for your help and guidance ladies! Keep up the great work and excellent customer service!

name: rytonic
text: can't never talk to anyone  and website not helpful

name: Jan Wright
text: This place sucks, there is no reason you should have to wait for 3 or 4 hours to get a car tag.  We need to vote these people out office.

name: Jesse Owens
text: There must be only one employee working. We got here about 15 minutes before opening and there was already a line it's been over an hour and we still haven't even been allowed inside.

name: Anthony Gregg
text: Staff is helpful and kind

name: Codie
text: Went to get tags. Long story short I’m diabetic and needed some sugar from my car. the security was concerned brought me some mint candys and told me if I need anything let him know. Best dmv ever!

name: Billy York
text: Customer service is non existent.  7 individuals in office,  only 2 processing tags while 8 people wait in line.  Our gov at work,  no concept of where priorities should be.  Your here to serve the people, not just push paper.

name: Terry underwood
text:
Has to be one of the worst DMV's I've had the luxury of dealing with. It's always slow, no survice or early renewals for people who work abroad and good luck getting someone to answer the phone or reply to your emails. I've literally had it up to here with this place and I'm requesting a place so that we can file complaints because if we're tax paying citizens we need to start requiring better public services. I'm finally given up on trying to renew my tags before leaving the vessel, hopefully the next 1000 miles no cop notices it.

10/1/2019
Today is suppose to be the day that I can finally get what I've been trying for over a month, RENEWAL information. Well I've emailed Elinor Outlaw several times and received one response whis is that I can't get the information until October 1st. Well today I've called 6 times or so and on the last time allowed the phone to ring so long thinking it'd aggravate someone to answer it, nope not the case. It finally ran its 11:00 min limit and stated press 0 for the operator. Well what do know, was available, so it said sending you to a backup operator, to no suprise also not available. We have to remove people like the above individuals who can't seem to manage a public office with the right personnel to do their jobs. I'm officially operating my motor vehicle with expired registration in a broken and dilapidated system. I will definitely start attending city council meetings, I refuse to pay my taxes for this type of service.

name: Corrie Flournoy
text: Friendly helpful people

name: Lala Singletary
text: For the time that I arrived,it was probably  good 10minute wait. So, not bad at all! Praise God!!!😁🙏🌈👏

name: Alberta Wright
text: They picked the wrong time to install new system.

name: Darren Reese
text: Great

name: JUWANA SPENCER
text: Absolutely Hate going to the Tag office

name: Thomas Morris
text: Slow, but the people are friendly.

name: B Monty
text: Best DMV experience in 13 years. The clerks actually smile!

name: Scott Killingsworth
text: Been in line for 2 hours, I moved 3 times, and I'm now leaving cause I'm not even half way to the counter

name: hector gonzalez
text: Just as any DMV or tag place in the US, there are good days and bad, if you go mid month your good but the first and last weeks are not.. not due to the employee's who are very polite and helpful, but the mass of people, I am on my way there now!! yeah!!

name: Keith Beck
text: Just another example of a bureaucratic government office that hasn't been voted in and can't be voted out.

name: Doc Spook
text: Very friendly and helpful DMV.  I didn’t have all my papers and they worked on something else while letting me call for them so i could get it done in one trip.   Thank you.

name: Kathy Cochran
text: A ROYAL PAIN to get things done

name: Tyler Harper
text: Some of the most incompetent people I have ever met. If you have a problem they send you away and tell you fix the one problem and then when you come back with the with that fixed they have something else that needed to be done so by the time you're done you've taken 4 days off work and now had to pay late fees.

name: Benjamin Freeman
text: Good honest people. Locals try to cheat the law and get turned away. That's where the low rates come from.

name: dawn griffin
text:
Closed Friday
...update this info online!!!...

name: Vanessa Lawley
text: Everytime I attempted to do it online, several yrs in a row, it will not let me. It locks me out and I make the trip to tag office. Obviously, bc of COVID-19, lines are longer. They have enclosed the partial walk with metal and glass. I got there at 3:30ish and got in line...it was backed up. I stood outside enclosed while it was it 90° degrees and sweated so bad. I waited to be flagged inside. It was cooler inside but not that much. By this time it was 3:45-3:50ish. They have designated stations. I understand people want to socialize when bumping into people, they haven't seen in awhile but please don't do it in line. Other people are waiting anxiously to check out. A pair stood there for 10mins talking small talk and not moving along. I find that to be disrespectful and lack of empathy for others waiting. Eventually, they separated. I went to the renewal station and she checked me out. It could have went quicker but she got distracted by another station and that customers problem. I stood there for add'l 5mins, listening to why a customer was asking about a specific charge to her account. The lady sat in her chair listening to it. I was hot, sweaty, and just ready to get my sticker already. I opted for cash bc they charge a ridiculous % to use a credit/debit card. She had me my paperwork but bc of the glass and length of table in front, I couldn't make out what she said bc of the conversations taking place. I said am I done, when I grabbed my papers? She couldn't hear me either. She said your finished have a nice day. I said Thank you and out the door I went! It was now 4:15ish p.m. It used to not be that way....but obviously bc of COVID-19 things have changed! I'll keep going back every year to endure it. I went at the end of the month on the last day! Of course, I'm sure it doesn't matter what day I go....Ill get stuck in line again. They have a window with a speaker and drawer, on the outside of building. Maybe they can utilize that with just renewals next year. Hope this helps!

name: Jacob Penton
text: The clerks at the counter were very nice and patient, and kept the lines moving at a good pace :)

name: Ashley Clarke
text: Received a phone call today in regards to my tag renewal. Was given a number to call back; however, the line which I was told to call back is for "informational use" only and no one answers the phone. I called back within minutes of receiving the original call. Please consider having an additional line that can be answered to address calls that people are returning when they have been asked to return a phone call.

name: Denise Jarrett Norcross
text: They've posted online what you need for various scenarios (new car from dealer, new car from individual, etc) - when you have what you need - it is a quick and smooth process! When you don't, they are still polite - but can't help you until you do!

name: Tracy McDaniel
text: The new waiting area has no AC.    It is a glass hall way with no air moving , in the south, in the summer.... greenhouse anyone?

name: gloria ramirez
text: Called up to the tag office for a simple question and the lady that answered the phone was incredibly rude. Smh I don’t get some people. Fair to say normally I have had good experiences with this office.

name: Stephanie Anderson
text: The building was very outdated, not really clean. The lady was coughing really bad, which she shouldn't have been at work. I was very uncomfortable with her cough, and covid going around! Other than that she was polite and helpful

name: Bri Garrett
text: Although it was packed, they got me in and out pretty quickly.

name: Tammy Cloer
text: Short lines and very patient.  Took no time at all

name: Anne Taddicken
text: No issues quick in and our great process in place.

name: billy wright
text: Nice group of lady's working there, thank you for your help.

name: Crochet Nora
text: No disabled or handicapped courtesy. Disabled and walk with a cane. I stood in line for well over an hour. I could hardly walk and had tears in my eyes by the time it was my turn. Once my turn came I asked if they offered any kind of courtesy for people who cant stand for such long periods of time. I was told no. The worker did say that I should have asked another patron to hold my spot for me. That sometimes that works. WOW. Then instead of allowing me to transfer my handicap from previous state. They wanted a local doctor to fill out a form. Double WOW. I spent a week having to park so far from locations that I ended up bedridden for several days.

name: Charlie Rigsby
text: I successfully got my thank you and I appreciate

name: Julie Parker
text: They've always been very courteous, kind and efficient to me.

name: Melissa Abbott
text: One of the reasons I dislike going to Clanton...people think they are so overworked at businesses in this area...including here!  They have no personality and act as if they are doing you a favor to wait on you!  Tried to call and couldn't even get a live person on the phone to answer my question. Answering a phone and helping a customer at the same time can be done...it's called multi tasking! This town is so backwards...and crooked...it's all about who you know..most of these people wouldn't  make it in the real business world!

name: Linda Dennis
text: Computers down 5/20/21

name: Terry Sinks
text: Fast service

name: Vernetta Wright
text: They were awesome!!

name: Glenn Mitchell
text: Make sure you have everything with you when you go.

name: Amber Driver
text: Wait was very long

name: Karenrobinson 888 Whitman11
text: Very slow due to the virus

name: Daphne Tanton
text: Worst service ever don’t know how to get to work they stand around

name: Michael Reeves
text: Very professional

name: Michael Harper
text: Took 2 hrs to get my tags

name: Acy Green
text: Good

name: CWB 205
text: Worst customer service ever.This office never answers calls!!!!!!!!

name: Carlos Ortigoza
text: Same as the other reviewers

name: Kyle Colquett
text: Not friendly at all. Took daughter to get permit. Online  and a note on the door Said they closed at 3:45. We got there at 2:45 and the lady told us it was closed. I told her they said 3:45 was closing and she said “we are closed. You can go to New Brockton, Dothan, or Troy”. Sad to get this type of review consistently for your own county.

name: Edie Wheat
text: Super nice and very welcoming and helpful.Very courtese

name: Kristina Craig
text: Go to Evergreen! Helpful, friendly, and puts your child at ease while they take the road test.  Andalusia was none of these.

name: Kaeli Mora
text: The workers are so rude and act put out for every question, inconvenient paperwork, and they do not know how to speak to people. The lady got aggravated when I kept asking her to repeat her self to the point she yelled at me and in hard of hearing. I was not asking her to repeat to be rude but because I couldn't hear her.

name: Matt Aughtman
text: I have been trying to call this place for weeks because I was told you need an appointment. Never answers the phone lets it ring till voicemail, no callbacks show up to talk the lady super bad attitude. Was the same exact thing 10 years ago and still nothing has changed??? My god when are they gonna actually do something to help the people and at least make folks feel happy and welcome to be here... It amazes me that even afyer so long this place is still exactly the same with even more very poor reviews and ratings....

name: Colby Sheehan
text: Recently moved here. Went to switch my out of state license to this state. If I could give a negative star review I would. Very disappointed and displeased with the service. The lady’s who work here are unprofessional and extremely rude. Have been here for nearly over two hours now waiting in the heat, and even called to schedule an appointment when we arrived. Called again after two hours of waiting!!! to be told they are working as fast as they can and wouldn’t even tell us where we were at on the list nor how long we would have to wait here still. THIS IS ATTACHED TO THE COURT HOUSE?!? CHANGE NEEDS TO BE DONE!

name: Simon Parducci
text: Very helpful and friendly.

name: Abbie Anderson
text: Do not recommend. Everyone in the waiting area was ranting about past experiences with the place, and you're not allowed to take even a written test with an out-of-state id. I was denied my written learner's permit test because the office was closing in five minutes, though a posted sign clearly stated that you could take a test, as long as you were finished a 4:30. It was three. Please go anywhere but Andalusia.

name: Victoria Sechler
text: Where do I file a complaint, this woman that works here carrie's on conversations that do not pertain to her job with everyone that goes through this door. You need to find a professional to do this job. Seriously!!!

name: Kelly Nester
text: Need more people working slow

name: Sam Reeves
text: If I could give it a zero I would. The service here is the slowest i've seen anywhere else. No one in the waiting room was very pleased with the service.

name: Jason Mowat
text: Nobody ever answers the phones there

name: Elizabeth Espitia-Douglas
text: This was the best experience I've ever had here. As long as you're renewing your license with a star, without any changes, you can go to the probate office (101) instead of the DMV. After realizing this I was in and out in less than 5 minutes.

name: Eric Trahan
text: Wonderful experience renewing my license and getting my travel star. Mrs. Flowers was wonderful to chat with and actually knew how to pronounce my name.

name: Susan May
text: Officers at front are wonderful. Very informative. 3 star rating is for the difficulty getting in to transfer my driver's license from FL to AL. Don't understand why they can't let you make appts online or over phone.

name: Keith Serafin
text: Decent long wait but lady from decatur came to fill in and was very pacient and nice let.me.run back to get documents!

name: Pamela Gaddy
text: Very professional, but extremely helpful, kind during this trying time. Both parties I dealt with at counter were great.

name: Wayne Grill
text: May need to call to make an appointment before going, I didn't and had a 5 hour waite.

name: Cliff Campbell
text: Friendly and knowledgeable service from state examiners office , Thanks. Oh yeah and he passed:)

name: Kerion Thayer
text: Very organized, we had a 1pm appointment and was sitting in front of an agent by 1:05pm.

name: Marie Lindsey
text: The examiner Trish, was awesome and very helpful!

name: Remus
text: Called to get a new license and was told there was nothing they could do to help me. I’m currently active military and out of state. Thought more of my home state until now.

name: Patricia Van Wert
text: They are only taking 60 people a day. How are people supposed to get driver's licenses or register vehicles or do anything else if they can't get necessary driver and vehicles services?

name: Jay Tabor
text: In spite of all the temp taking, 6 foot separation and 5am lines to get on the Dl list, the folks at the courthouse were courteous, professional and worked hard to get our drivers license finished and vehicles registered, thank you!

name: Destiny Salter
text: Drove 1:30 because they said they were doing there permit and driving test and they couldn’t do either because no “state examiner” was present, that tad bit of information would’ve been nice too leave on your voicemail

name: Bobby Johnson
text: Great folks

name: Pete Davis
text: Not too bad of a wait.

name: Zerelda Hammer
text: Professional, friendly, and efficient

name: Mark Dasian
text: Lots of window counters with no one manning them... seems like everyone goes to lunch at the same time and only 2 windows open..  they should stagger the lunch shifts so half the windows at least are manned.. would reduce the wait times and frustration level of the customers..  but they did get the job done so I didnt spend more than 30 minutes there ..

name: J Mills
text: Needed a tag for the new car. Walked in and the line was loooong. At first I thought I would just come back another time but changed my mind when I saw that it was moving pretty steadily. Patrons were helped effeciently and i moved up quickly. Was pleasantly surprised by that and very impressed with the nice lady at window #7. She was courteous and knowledgeable and got us out quickly. Very impressed with our visit

name: Sandra Perry
text: The employees be very nice polite just a long wait

name: David Friedeberg
text: excellent service, very helpful.  no wait

name: Moses Billups
text: Pretty quick! I went on a Tuesday at 10:30am

name: Susan Henderson
text: Long line of people, not staff fault,most people waiting in line didn't  have all their info

name: Vanessa Fields Brown
text: They are always friendly, weather it be renewing a ID, getting a car title/tag or getting a business license they are very knowledgeable and efficient.  They are doing wonderful with the Covid restrictions as well.

name: Rj Norwood
text: Extremely long lines poor service. Will be there all day

name: Grace Yancy
text: The lines were long, but, very efficient. The downtown branch is better.

name: Joe Ware
text: Good progress set up for social distancing.

name: Marcus Graham
text: Out in no time Thank's

name: Dustin Gibson
text: Extremely quick and courteous staff. Never seen a RMV/DMV so fully staffed before. I was able to get everything I needed done within 6 minutes waiting less than a minute.

name: Delois Brown
text: Great

name: Kenneth Green
text: Everyone was polite and helpful overall a pleasant experience 😊

name: -chosen-
text: Horrible workers. Stank attitude

name: Dean Benedict
text:
Fast Fast Fast...
It makes me feel very lucky not to be in Jefferson County where a trip to the DMV can take hours or even a day.  This is another experience altogether.  Well done Tuscaloosa county!

name: Marvin Odell
text: Waiting in the long line for over 45 minutes just made my day!!!😷😃👍

name: Bing Bing
text: The employee was not nice when they answer a phone call. They hung up before I finished my sentence.

name: Charles Nichols
text:
Was here shortly after they opened.
Friendly, professional and fast service.

name: Cole Duncan
text: Don't let the employee submitted reviews fool you. They do not have it together. Extremely slow service, long wait lines, and DO NOT call them.  You will not get through, and you will be sent to voicemail to "prevent excessively long wait times"

name: MarkAElliott7
text: As DMVs go, this is the best that I've seen. The employees are courteous and actually seem interested in getting people processed quickly.

name: Edwin H Kluge Jr
text: RIDESHARE CHECK THE MAP

name: Shandreka Mitchell
text: Nice and polite

name: Susan Viola
text: Always so kind and fast!

name: YT_monkeyrage
text: Call 7 times no one answered ughh

name: Kenbriell Dixon
text: Fast and friendly

name: RM Jones
text: They are awesome

name: Han Fang
text: Extremely fast, wow, good service!

name: Bre Harris
text: I was able to walk in and get tag with no line.

name: amanda moore
text:
Never thought I'd say this kind of thing about a courthouse tag office...but here we are... I really like the ladies there that I have met since I've moved out to this area, and they're always patient and willing to help out with the tag stuff. I'm not even just saying it to say it, cause if I don't have anything nice to say about a place, I won't say it. I'm only here to give a review because Google minds my business and sent me a notification about my visit....
I usually just exit out of it, but I decided to go ahead and write a review, because they helped me out alot today. I didn't think to get anyone's name this time through,  but it was the ladies on the property tax and driver's license side this time, although the ones on the side where they have done tags for me before are also really kind and helpful. Google just didn't ask me how I felt last time😂😂 anyways, I like to compliment when someone helps me out so here it is... I'm not as mindful about business like that as I should be, but they helped me get sorted today and I am so relieved.
So thanks again. 😊

name: William Tyree
text: The young ladies at the window are awesome, the sheriff at the door however is rude, hostile & just not a good person. Made the whole experience horrible, left out without completing what I came there to do.

name: Chris Mahan
text: Everything went through quickly and professionally. Great customer service made the process simple.

name: Brian Reid
text: Friendly and knowledgeable people. Good customer service.

name: Belinda Nelson
text: The there was a line,  but hay it's the first of the month ! The Lady's are always helpful and friendly ! They do their job! They make you feel at home !

name: Dennis Putnam
text: Excellent service, fast and very nicr

name: Daniel Martin
text: In and out . the people there are great

name: Terri Fields
text: It was great everyone was very curious and got everyone out in a timely manner

name: Kris Tribble
text: The woman that works the DMV needs psychiatric help, a new job in a quiet room and absolutely no interaction with the public. This DMV is becoming notorious for the crazy mean lady that yells at everyone and might complete a dozen licenses in a day. Hands down the worst DMV I have used. Please relocate the DMV lady Oneonta city leaders. Have some pride in your city. This woman is the face of your court/licensing system for most people.Thanks for reading and have a good day all!

name: Donna Self
text: Great service. Quick, helpful and friendly.

name: Hunter Ballard
text: The signs pointing in & out of building sould be added I got so scared walking back I got lost because of the stairs mad & upset poor lady helped me go back to where I needed to be

name: james valentine
text:
Always a great experience.
Lots of smiles unlike Jefferson County.

name: Linda Cloud
text: The lady was very nice and helpful

name: Chuck Burasinski
text: Extremely efficient and pain free...👍👍👍

name: Billy Sharp
text: Very polite,knowledgeable and helpful.

name: Not of This world
text: I bought my truck and paid over $600 for my tag because of tax.. my truck has been put in my dad's name because of the address,  I STILL OWN THE TRUCK !! I have told them several times and it is still in my dad's name .. now the vehicle has been suspended because of no insurance proof.. I have been paying full coverage insurance on the vehicle since I bought it .. how in the hell can a truck and FOP tag registered to me be put in my dad's name without paperwork showing it.. the address doesn't mean s**t !! And after advising them of it .. I got an excuse and it was never fixed..

name: Kimberly Sciro
text: Very  nice people fast service

name: Ben Perkins
text: Very nice staff who were very patient with impatient people.

name: James Ray Young
text: In and out.fast courteous service

name: elizabeth mcmillian
text: The best ever ! Sherrif was perfect n 5min in n out !!! I love Blount county !!!!

name: Justyn belcherr
text: I’ve been waiting for over 2 months for my title to come in and I’ve had to go up there twice cause they won’t answer the phone for a question. Some how there messing things up and honestly sick of it. Also the lady at the drivers license place is super rude

name: Johnny Wester
text: Just needed to have a little more paperwork.

name: Beth Chaffin
text: If I could give 0 stars, I would. The woman who works in the permit/license office in Oneonta is one of the rudest people I have ever met. It was ridiculous. There is no reason for someone who works with the public to act and talk to anyone the way she talked to me and my daughter the entire time we were there. If the website says you close at 4:30, then you shouldn’t rant about and to someone who came in at 3:35 with two people working and no waiting line.

name: Alicia Matyi Glasscock
text: This is the best place to get your tag renewed. I never have to wait in line and the taxes are cheaper. They are always nice and polite. Makes me glad I live in Blount County. 😆

name: Katie Payne
text: The lady in the permit drivers licence exams office is the rudest lady. She was rude to everyone that walked in and out off the office fromh the time i was there from the time I went home. She was rude to 2 elderly women while I was waiting OVER 3 HOURS FOR A PERMIT TEST WHEN NOONE WAS AT THE COMPUTERS. Every one was complaing about her. and everyone was very upset with her from her tone to her rude behavior. Seems that an older woman in her 50+ would know common respect for someone other than your self. Will NEVER come back to onteonta courthouse again. She told me to be here at 1, at 11 O'Clock because she had to do drivers test for others, I didn't complain I simply left. Until I noticed the" be back at 1 sign at lunch " therefore she completely lied to me and my mother. She doesn't deserve to work in this line of work without knowing the fact that she will be surrounded  by people daily. Nobody deserves the treatment me and MANY others received. She was the exact same way when I came months ago. Rude. I would give her an even worse review if I could.

name: Angela Taylor
text: The lady handling the drivers road test and all the paperwork was the nicest person. I just wanted to say thank you !

name: Jacob Reid
text: Seem like a friendly group of people that work here, but apparently if you are trying to get your Alabama license you need be here before 4pm even though they close at 5pm because that's when the State Examiner leaves.  That tid bit of information would have been very helpful before I drove 45 mins.

name: Steven Gross
text: This is freaking wrong. Google sucks.

name: Ed Edd&Eddy
text: this is where mike pence lived as a child

name: adam quick
text: They need to change the time from 5pm to 4pm,

name: John Laird
text: Always a pleasure doing business with , very nice people!

name: Brent Caldwell
text: Fast service

name: Anglea Martin
text:
Hello my son needed a None Driver License ID
Went to Selma ,Alabama .We are from Camden Alabama the clerk that was at the front door was so very,
very,very nice. We love the experience keep up the great work.

name: Tammy Thomas
text: Wonderful food and peaceful setting.  Friendly service!

name: Sygitia N AL
text: Mrs.Chappell was the best. Highly professional,  with very good customer service.

name: Robbie Mosley
text: Horrible experience. So rude and hateful.

name: Diane Nelson
text: It was Awesome and the people there are kind and thoughtful wow.

name: Makesha Murray
text: It was ok but could've been better.

name: Stephanie Carter
text: Horrible horrible wait a minute did I say HORRIBLE Website ever!!!! Do not even deserve a 1 star however it would not let me comment otherwise.

name: Melinda Daniels
text: If I could give no stars I would. Rudest people I have ever done business with. Personally I believe they should quit because there are hundreds of people in need of a job and would do a better job at it if given the opportunity.

name: Safford Trading Company
text: People who work there are rude and could care less about people, it's sad that they hate their jobs so much. If you don't like what you do and enjoy it then find a new job!!!!!!

name: LaDamian Goree (Goreeboy)
text: It isn't as slow as other offices I've been to plus it's open more days a week than a few other local offices.

name: DeLacy Curl
text: Quick, easy, and friendly. I renewed my ID and they had me in and out. Ensure you come with all of your documents and it will be a quick visit.

name: Patricia Macready
text: No line at3 on a Monday afternoon. Quick and easy to get STAR license. Had all my docs with me. Polite and friendly service. ❤️ My City.

name: Douglas Rush
text: Very friendly and fast service.   I needed the Star ID and I was in and out in 30 minutes.  Both women working there are friendly and professional

name: Kirby Thompson
text: Excellent service.  Replaced lost documents.  Friendly folks, very helpful!

name: Shankar V
text: Very helpful staff. Got my job done in less than 2 minutes.

name: Bob Douglas
text: The staff was really friendly.  Made the two hour wait seem not as long.

name: jessie atwell
text: I took my brother in for the written/driver's test. We were in and out in a little over 2 hours. The ladies working were very knowledgeable and kind.

name: Eric Reda
text: Extremely friendly staff, very efficient and quick. Office adheres to CDC COVID guidelines; every one masked and being safe.

name: Robert Davis
text: Wonderful experience, friendly staff

name: DataKiller
text: It does have a wait but it's very clean and the tester's are very courteous.

name: Alex adam
text:
Fast service.
Thank you

name: Andrew Rolfsen
text:
The work ethic at this office is very poor. The lines are always long and they will bump EVERYONE that's been waiting for HOURS to do a driving test. There are usually only one or two people working. They close their office from noon to 1, regardless of whether or not they have people there that have been waiting all morning. It generally takes them 30-45 minutes to process 1 permit.

Good luck getting them to answer their phones. They shut them off.

Here's a hint for whichever department runs this show:
Hire more people or start making the office by appointment only.

name: Frank Rivers
text:
One examination person on duty, if you are not the 1st. 5 people in line before lunch, ..........you're out of luck.
If you are not the 3rd. Person in line after lunch,  ...........you're out of luck.
Limited seating. ...........

name: Stephanie Qrys
text:
Got my "Real" / star ID with relative ease.  Called ahead to make sure I had all the documents needed on hand.  The office was a little understaffed so there was about a 40-minute wait to be seen.  The staff members were friendly and the actual process of getting my license was pretty quick.

The worst part of the trip was the impatient people whining. Patience is a virtue y'all!

name: Marisha G
text:
Absolutely horrible place! I waited three and a half hours to be told I could I couldn't get a license transfer. I verified all my information on the website and with the individual working when I checked in. She told me I was good to go. When it was finally my turn I was told I needed an additional document not listed! After waiting over three hours I was turned away and told to just make an appointment in Montgomery and not wait here again.

This place is unprofessional. There are no clear directions on the site or in the office. They are understaffed with only one person working.

name: Mariah Arnold
text: They never answer the phone and take way too long to get both my permit and license (too different trips, both a hassle).

name: colleen vinti laundry
text: Horrible. Sat there for 2 hours only to have them tell us to come back monday morning at 8am!

name: Bo Byrd
text: The lady at the desk with the long nails was awesome, so I suspect the reason this place has so many bad reviews is because of the other lady; she was the one waddling around who does the road tests - she was awful.

name: Randall Davis
text:
My son was scheduled to do his road test in Birmingham but it was raining and would be all day
We drove down to this location and were amazed. The location was perfect....the lady working was very nice. He was first in line to drive. She explained everything about how he did on the drive. I would never go to the one in Birmingham after visiting this one. Was it worth the drive? I would drive twice as far :)

name: Jim Middlebrooks
text: Real good setup to perform their jobs

name: Kat Astrophe
text: Fast , organized and nice!  Even with high volume!

name: Lindsey Wright
text: Little wait not to bad staff was courteous

name: t nagrom nagrom
text: I was just told  on the phone by an employee, that even though the hours say until 4:30 pm that they could stop processing a 4 pm.  So I guess their hours should read from 8 am until whenever in the $%^# they feel like it.

name: ghost killer
text: It's ok place to get what you need like a ID or driver's license

name: Lindsey Martin
text: officer was pleasant and helpful

name: Everett Brooks
text: Great experience fast friendly service

name: jojo Hunt
text: Needs more staff ......called for 3 hours trying to find out what paperwork was needed....no answer ......got there at 11:15 ......lady behind the desk said i stop taking people at 11 because i close from 12-1 for lunch ......get back up there at 12:40 ......waited for them to open ......opened at 1 ......then set there till 2:30 for a 15 minute test .....then another 20 mins just to print the permit out .....and on top of all this ....there was literally 20 people there that needed to be helped ......i really hope no one was told to come back tomorrow cause it was closing time

name: David Moreno
text: Polite and helpful.

name: Will Moseley
text: They will never answer the phone or call back and when you go in they are rude

name: Grace Kelley
text: Fast and efficient

name: Angel Fagan
text: It's too small for the clientele they provide for and not enough people to serve people in a timely manner. I've been there 3 times and still have yet to get my license transferred

name: Sarah Hunt
text: FYI Go early to get one of the very limited spots. Her lunch is 12 to 1 so if u show up at 11:30 to bad come back after 1. They only do 5 driving tests in the morning and afternoon then they do 10 ID’s after that. That’s ALL they will do. Oh and sign in on the clipboard even though the sign on the door says stop and wait outside.

name: Johnny Huett
text: Great as always

name: Ora Jones
text: You don't have to wait in line more than 6 to 8 min they have4window they are very quick getting your information I luv it.

name: Elma Babin
text: I enjoy my visit this morning the cashier was very polite

name: Mary Hofstadter
text: In and out pretty fast the lady that waited on me was very professional and very sweet

name: Jane Griffin
text: Very courteous staff. Quick and organized.

name: Smitty Johnson
text: Love going here for everything I can. The lines are always short and the staff is always friendly and professional

name: Anthony Ruffin
text: No line in and out. Clerk super nice

name: Gerald Cassavaugh
text: The people working or very nice and very polite they made it really easy and very quick and I was in and out

name: Rj Norwood
text: Slow service

name: Nathan Terry
text: The lack of respect for people's time is what kills me about the Tag office. People have to burn PTO to make enough time to go up there only to be told they don't have the right paper work, after waiting in line for 2 hrs. and the leave having accomplished nothing. I understand that it's not even the fault of the women behind the counter most of the time. I know some things are out of their control. There really should be more open lines. Three out of the five windows were open while I was there. They need ten lines with 10 workers! Imagine gong to Wal-Mart and only a few lanes are open while you stand in a long....oh wait, never mind.

name: Randy Cornelius
text: Make sure you come early in the morning if you're renuing your car tags.  I got their at 815 am. And waited over 2 hr's to renew my tags make shure to have plenty of time on your hands

name: Derek Beaty
text: Always time consuming and terrible. Only two women working and a line packed out the door. Same thing every time. The officers at the door are always the highlight of this place.

name: TONJA HERRING
text: I give a zero for the service at this place. I hate to even think I have  to come here. Who ever is in charge on how to run this place needs to to be replaced. I understand that we are in bad times but there is a better way to do business. I came up there to just transfer my title and cant even get in.  I live 30 minutes away and work 1 hour and 15 min away and can not just pop up just hoping to get service. I went to Muscle Shoals court house just hoping they could help me since I live just on the Lawrence County line they was open and ready to try to help my as much as possible but of course they apologized and said I would have to come there. When I try to call you can not even talk to anyone. There needs to be a overhaul on this place.

name: Justin Pitts
text: Literally pathetic!! I don’t see why we even have a tag office if this is all we have. Constantly rude and disrespectful. I get there an hour and a half before they close just to get told they don’t have time

name: Full Run through
text: This place is a GD joke. Leave Lawrence Co, NOW!!!

name: Mike Schutz
text: Very rude and extremely unhelpful people. They fat fingered my vehicle VIN number a year ago and are now giving me the run around for this years renewal.

name: CJ 239
text: They dont even answer the phone

name: Collateral 915
text: Awful service. Literally pathetic. I wouldnt treat my dogs half as rude as the desk clerks here. A bunch of people come in and they close desks down to go talk to each other in the back and eat.

name: mike cook
text: Need to give more information

name: Katie lavender
text: Want answer the phone to ask a question have to drive all the way there

name: Jake Spencer
text: Terrible... But no choice

name: JH SULLIVAN
text: The clerks are very conscientious,  courteous, and helpful. Never a long line or more than a five minute wait even during peak hours.

name: SOMÉA AFRIKA.
text:
Wonderful
Clean, quick, welcoming with good customer service.
It took 8 minutes to get my license renewed.

name: jerry means
text: Ms McReynolds was absolutely 💯amazing with the services and information provided!!

name: James Cheney
text: Very quick and efficient workers. If you need to go to a private office in the Baldwin County area this is the one to go to. No need for appointments too!

name: jonathon ruelle
text: The easiest dmv trip ever. I made an appoint but it wasn't even necessary. They are quick and accurate

name: Cherika Jones
text: Easy,convenient and really quick service to get my tag...Thanks Lynn!!! 🤗

name: Ron Penrod
text: The easiest place to get your title work, registration or whatever else you may need done

name: Joey Williams
text:
Worst experience. Site says operating hours are till 4:30. First trip arrive at 3:35 but they say they won’t take applicants after 3:30.
Second trip, check my little girl out of school at 2:30 and arrive at 2:45 pm.
Now they say they won’t take anyone else because today they say they are busy.
They only do this ONE DAY PER WEEK. ITS A DRIVING PERMIT.
Ridiculous. So basically they take applicants when it’s convenient  with no specific hours of operation. If you are going to be open ONE DAY per week for customers. Can you at least staff to meet your OWN advertised operating hours??
Good grief.

name: Dave Hardin
text: Quick and polite service!

name: Dianne Bohannan
text: Friendly and professional service

name: Kathy Harville
text: SLOW
